title: What kinds of poisonous snakes are in the waterways/lakes/ponds around Wilmington? Is there a posting to warn the public from swimming in such waters?
text:
The
cottonmouth moccasin is the most common venomous snake found in local
waters. I've never seen a sign warning of snakes in the water, but I
have seen signs warning of alligators.



Here's a link to a story I wrote a few years back:
http://www.starnewsonline.com/article/20070907/NEWS/709070317?p=all&tc=pgall



It provides an overview of common poisonous snakes found in the
region.



Thanks again for writing to MyReporter.com.
